required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Pharmacokinetic Parameters Between Adopters of Electronic Cigarettes and a Historical Sample of Combustible Cigarette Smokers
clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Assess Nicotine Pharmacokinetic Parameters of Digital Vapor Cigarettes in Adopters and Compare Them to Nicotine Pharmacokinetic Parameters of Cigarettes in Smokers

brief_summary.textblock: This study assesses the nicotine pharmacokinetic (PK) parameters in adopters of electronic cigarettes following a 12-hour tobacco and nicotine abstinence. The PK results of this study will be compared to historical data on smokers obtained in prior studies, as well as on naïve and short-term users of electronic cigarettes.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an observational, open-label study to assess the nicotine pharmacokinetic (PK) parameters over a 6-hour period in adopters of electronic cigarettes with respect to an in-clinic 10-minute ad libitum period following a 12-hour tobacco and nicotine abstinence. In addition to PK parameters, subjective effects of urge for product will be assessed over a 6-hour period concurrently with the collection of the PK blood samples following a protocol defined schedule. The results of this study will be compared to historical PK and urge for product data obtained from smokers as well as naïve and short-term users of electronic cigarettes. In addition to the PK parameters and urge for product outcomes, plasma will be assessed for cotinine concentration prior to the 12-hour abstinence period.

primary_outcome.measure: Nicotine pharmacokinetics with respect to initiation of in-clinic investigational product use following a 12-hour tobacco and nicotine abstinence
primary_outcome.description: Determine area under the plasma nicotine concentration versus time curve (AUC)

primary_outcome.measure: Nicotine pharmacokinetics with respect to initiation of in-clinic investigational product use following a 12-hour tobacco and nicotine abstinence
primary_outcome.description: Determine maximum plasma concentration (Cmax), baseline adjusted

other_outcome.measure: Nicotine pharmacokinetics with respect to initiation of in-clinic investigational product use following a 12-hour tobacco and nicotine abstinence
other_outcome.description: Determine time to maximum plasma nicotine concentration (Tmax), baseline adjusted

other_outcome.measure: Subjective effects scores for Urge for Product (UFP) with respect to initiation of in-clinic investigational product use following a 12-hour tobacco and nicotine abstinence
other_outcome.description: Score subjective effects using a numeric rating scale to determine area under the UFP score-versus-time curve (AUEC)

arm_group.description: VUSE® Original Digital Vapor Cigarettes (29 mg nicotine)
VUSE® Menthol Digital Vapor Cigarettes (29 mg nicotine)

intervention.description: VUSE® Digital Vapor Cigarettes (original flavor, 29 mg nicotine)
VUSE® Digital Vapor Cigarettes (menthol flavor, 29 mg nicotine)

study_pop.textblock: Generally healthy males and females 21 to 60 years of age who are exclusive users of electronic cigarettes.
